definition: to sound out/to probe/to feel out/to try out
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

sentences.english: Both labour and management were putting out feelers.
sentences.chinese: 劳资双方相互试探对方。

sentences.english: Do you feel it out to see what the situation is?
sentences.chinese: 你会小心试探一下，看看是什么状况吗？

sentences.english: Because he himself suffered when he was tempted, he is able to help those who are being tempted.
sentences.chinese: 他自己既然被试探而受苦，就能撘救被试探的人。

sentences.english: Because he himself suffered when he was tempted, he is able to help those who are being tempted.
sentences.chinese: 他自己既然被试探而受苦，就能撘救被试探的人。

sentences.english: Backtracking line search is carried out when the trust region trail step fails.
sentences.chinese: 当信赖域试探步失败时我们进行回溯线搜索。

sentences.english: This is a misunderstanding of maturity. You will never outgrow temptation.
sentences.chinese: 这是对成熟的误解，因你永远不能免于试探。

sentences.english: If you never had a trial, How could you call yourself an overcomer?
sentences.chinese: 如果你不曾经过试探，你怎能说你是得胜者？

sentences.english: XuanZu pretends to zen to light the sea king, to test the courtiers faithfulness.
sentences.chinese: 宣祖假装要禅位给光海君，以此试探臣子们的忠心。

sentences.english: I extended my hands, and they tentatively suckled at my fingers.
sentences.chinese: 我伸出双手，随后它们试探性地吮吸着我的手指。

sentences.english: She brought the final temptation into Samson's life.
sentences.chinese: 她为参孙带来最厉害的试探。

sentences.english: The editorial was a trail balloon to test the public's reaction to a change in the school day.
sentences.chinese: 这篇社论是要试探出公众对于变更校历的反应。

sentences.english: And oft escaped the tempter's snare by thy return, sweet hour of prayer.
sentences.chinese: 试探网罗得以脱离，我惟靠此祷告良辰。

sentences.english: I am putting out feeler to see if she would like to come and work for us.
sentences.chinese: 我正在试探她，看她愿不愿意来为我们工作。

sentences.english: A spiny lobster shyly crawls across the seafloor.
sentences.chinese: 长满刺的龙虾试探着爬过海底。

sentences.english: This suggests the market can retest the 21000 level.
sentences.chinese: 这表明市场可能会试探21000点的位置。

sentences.english: " Perhaps we can help, " the president offered speculatively.
sentences.chinese: “也许我们能提供些帮助，”总统试探着提议道。

definition: to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
to pry into/to spy on/to probe into
to guard against/to be vigilant/watch you don't (slip)/also pr. [ti2 fang2]
lit. to toss a stone to find out what's ahead (idiom)/fig. to test the waters
to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
to make discreet inquiries/to scout out
